title: Scenario: Travel Plans
reading_greek:
DIALOGUE
- Τι ώρα φεύγει το πλοίο; (What time does the boat leave?)
- Στις οκτώ. (At eight.)
- Πόση ώρα κάνει; (How long does it take?)
- Τρεις ώρες. (Three hours.)
- Θέλω ένα εισιτήριο για Πάρο. (I want a ticket for Paros.)
- Πότε θα πάτε; (When will you go?)
- Αύριο το πρωί. (Tomorrow morning.)

KEY VOCAB
- Πλοίο (Boat/Ship)
- Εισιτήριο (Ticket)
- Φεύγει (Leaves)
- Φτάνει (Arrives)
- Αύριο (Tomorrow)
- Σήμερα (Today)
reading_english:
SCENARIO: THE TICKET OFFICE

1. TIME (Stis...): 
   - Stis okto (At eight).
   - Stis dyo (At two).

2. DURATION (Posi ora?):
   - Posi ora kanei? (How much time does it 'do'/take?)
   - Mia ora (One hour).

3. FUTURE (Tha):
   - Pote tha pate? (When will you go?)
   - Tha pao avrio (I will go tomorrow).
audio_script:
You are at the port of Piraeus. You need a ticket.

Use the verb 'Thelo' (I want) + Accusative. 
'Thelo ena eisitirio'. (I want a ticket).

Ask about time:
'Ti ora fevγει?' (What time does it leave?).
'Ti ora ftanei?' (What time does it arrive?).

And understand the answer:
'Stis okto' (At 8).
'Se deka lepta' (In 10 minutes).

Bon voyage! (Kalo taxidi!)

quiz_questions.question: What does 'Posi ora kanei?' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: Literally 'How much time does it do?'.
